snippet: Ahmad al-Jarba, president of the Syrian National Coalition, hardened his position and also said talks must be put off until the rebels made military gains.
abstract: Ahmad al-Jarba, president of the Syrian National Coalition, says opposition will not negotiate with President Bashar al-Assad or his inner circle and that talks could only take place when the military situation in Syria is positive for rebel forces.

byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: Ahmad al-Jarba, president of the Syrian National Coalition, hardened his position and also said talks must be put off until the rebels made military gains.

headline.main: Head of Syrian Opposition Rejects Talks With Assad
headline.print_headline: Head of Syrian Opposition Rejects Talks With Assad

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
